answers.answer: Oh wow, they didn't do a 3 hour test?I have the gestational diabetes too, my doctor said to just watch the sugars I eat and no more soda. Drink only water.
Its mostly just cut out sugars and go very easy on carbs. Drink lots of water And work out. That's how I keep my sugars down.

They want me to do the 3 hour one as well but they already said I have it so I don't see why lol I'm already not drinking soda but I love tea. I use artificial sweeteners but I read we shouldn't have those either?! What exercises are good during pregnancy?  :)

I got gestational diabetes also. It actually isnt as hard as you think. I freaked out at first but its mostly about keeping an eye on ur carb intake and sugar. Soon they'll have u checking your blood sugar levels and you'll learn what makes your sugar levels high and what does.  They told me i could eat two fruits a day so thats not so bad because i love fruits as well. Lol
Well that's good to know :) I don't want to miss out on fruit! also as far as exercise I should mention that I have spotting so dr. Has told me to be in bed as much as possible!

question: I did the glucose test and they informed me that I failed and immediately signed me up for a nutritional class thing at the local hospital.  The thing is I'm only 4 weeks 6 days! I have heard most women don't get it until their 2nd trimester.  What can I expect and what will my diet look like? I'm disappointed that I won't be able to eat a lot of fruit which I love. And drink options seem incredibly minimal.  I will do it for my baby of course but idk alot about it so any info is appreciated :)
title: VERY early gestational diabetes?!
